description: This is a great worker placement/bag building game with a euro-style feel that is easy to teach and engage

April 2020-Easily one of my best games.  I find each part to be an interesting activity.  Bag building, using the people to activate actions, and get new people.  Knowing when to send people away, when the bag is no longer giving you what you need.  It all is so clever and just enough luck.  I own all of the expansions and they are all great.December 2019$29 Coolstuff INC

Pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed this. I enjoyed the varying strategies and setting up the technology tiles to create mini-engines. Overall, a bit on the light side but definitely a great casual and quick game.
Location: Kallax
Includes Trade & Intrigue expansion, promo tiles, Geekbits

title: I am excep...
description: I am exceptionally impressed with how intuitively the mechanics interact with the strategy in Orleans. Even though Orleans' gameplay contains a myriad of choices and the occasional bout of analysis paralysis, the game often feels incredibly streamlined because the resulting decisions and outcomes amalgamate into an extremely elegant, cohesive, and satisfying game.This game has a big flaw though. The level of variance from game to game is minimal.

title: Really nic...
description: Really nice resource management game. I like how you travel the roads to collect resources.

description: High rating, plays well with two, easy rules, so on the wish list.

title: One of the...
description: One of the best euros I've ever played. An absolute gem

title: Wonderful ...
description: Wonderful game, lots of routes to victory. Not overly complex and relatively easy to teach.

title: While I co...
description:
While I consider my self an omni-gamer, I definitely tend towards AT. I also normally avoid games whose title is a place. However, I make a big exception for Orleans. I love playing this game. There are so many things to do and strategies to try. 

Expansions Owned: Invasion, Trade and Intrigue

title: It's not p...
description:
It's not point-mongering, which is nice--you need to make a conscious decision to change from infrastructure to scoring. I found it to be fine, but the bag-building didn't strike me as enough to differentiate it from the hordes of comparable eurogames. This one also has front-loaded decisions and questionable balance (both in the form of the buildings), so there's that.
It's strange--Hyperborean bag-building grabs me, but this one doesn't.

title: This game ...
description: This game is super fun! Idk if this is in 9 territory but it's definitely a game I'd advocate for. Everyone should give it a try.

title: The game g...
description: The game gradually becomes more intense round after round. After the halfway point is when you need to really be looking at your opponents actions and planning for the end of the game. 18 rounds seems like a lot but I feel like the game should have more. Just when it gets good it ends, this leaves me wanting to play again which is what I desire in a game. This is easily in my top 5 favorite games played.(Play with the new bathhouse rule)

title: Bag builde...
description: Bag builder.  Enjoyable but feels like path to victory comes down to scholar track and building settlements.  Events not punitive enough to deter this strategy.

description: JV

title: In Orléans...
description: In Orléans, the options are wide open. Initially overwhelming but the charm comes from this "open" strategic field. Very enjoyable.

title: Love the b...
description: Love the bag building. So many viable strategies. Really fun game.

title: Really lov...
description: Really loving this game. Need to stop playing it when I am tired.

title: Deluxe Edi...
description:
Deluxe Edition
(there is a frustratingly separate entry for this)

Great game! The bag building is different enough from deck building that it makes the game fresh and exciting. The frustration of the bag draw is palpable. The multiple paths to victory are a big plus. The somewhat scripted game start makes this just a touch short of '10'. 

INCLUDED:
Orléans: Trade & Intrigue

title: A bag buil...
description:
A bag building worker placement game set in medieval France.
We own the fan made kit and the expansion Invasion and this has taken Orleans up another level.
I really enjoy this game, the fact you can play it solo, coop or as a euro depending on what takes your fancy knocks this out the park for me.
Not tried the Intrigue board yet from Trade & Intrigue, which adds even more variety to the game.

title: Upgraded c...
description: Upgraded components, 5th player deluxe version, and all expansions.

title: 2-4 player...
description:
2-4 players
90 minutes

title: We totally...
description:
We totally love this game—the pool building is an interesting mechanic. There were lots of options and lots of paths to victory, which we love, and plenty of thinking to keep us engaged.

The component quality is great—I especially like that the character tokens, that get handled so often, were thicker. Though we don’t particularly like the feel of velvet for the bags.
